Below is a list of useful listservs to consider joining -- note that it is unwise to join *all* of these listservs unless you want to begin receiving dozens of more emails every week. Only join those that seem relevant to your interests.

## Campus Listservs
* **CMSI-fyi**: to receive updates on happenings related to the Coastal & Marine Science Institute 
  + Contact <cmsi@ucdavis.edu> if you want to join
* **CMSI-careers**: to receive opportunities in marine & coastal science in/outside of UC Davis
  + Contact <cmsi@ucdavis.edu> if you want to join
* [**Undergraduate Research Center**](https://urc.ucdavis.edu/)
  + Instructions to join their listserv are [here](https://urc.ucdavis.edu/join-our-listserv)
* [**Internship & Career Center**](https://icc.ucdavis.edu/)
  + Instructions to join their listserv are [here](https://icc.sf.ucdavis.edu/services/email-mailing-lists-management)

## Other Listservs
* [**Coral-List**](https://coral.aoml.noaa.gov/mailman/listinfo/coral-list/): opportunities and updates in coral reef science
  + Subscribe at the bottom of [this page](https://coral.aoml.noaa.gov/mailman/listinfo/coral-list/)
* [**U.S. Harmful Algal Blooms**](http://mailman.whoi.edu/mailman/listinfo/us-hab)
* [**Seven Seas Media**](https://sevenseasmedia.org/): marine science in the United States and job opportuniteis across the country
  + Sign up [here](https://visitor.r20.constantcontact.com/manage/optin?v=001DTeZUiB7y8ACUe8ErFH1C0Q5n7jmXbyFzLX2Q1Qv6boiMxIVB9seTaAsqyseZN-MgC-y3ODA05elemhqMDBJRYeF-T5_YiTmESBNtnQmB00=&id=preview)
* **Es_jobs_net**: opportunities in environmental science
  + Subscribe [here](https://mailman.ucar.edu/mailman/listinfo/es_jobs_net)
* [**University-National Oceanographic Laboratory System (UNOLS)**](https://www.unols.org/): opportunities to join oceanographic cruises
  + Sign up for the mailing list [here](https://www.unols.org/form/contact-us-form)
* **ECOLOG-L**: academic and non-academic positions and updates in ecology
  + Sign-up instructions are [here](https://www.esa.org/membership/ecolog/)
* For Black Marine Scientists: [**Black in Marine Science "Members Only" Section**](https://www.blackinmarinescience.org/resources.html#login)
* [**LGBTQ + STEM**](Improving LGBTQ+ visilibility in STEM)
  + Instructions to sign up are [here](https://lgbtstem.wordpress.com/mailing-list/)
* [**New England Marine Science Opportunities**](https://groups.google.com/g/ne_marine_sci_opportunities?pli=1)
